name: Canada Post
address: Canada Post, 7160 Kerr St, Vancouver, BC V5S 3T0

featured_reviews.review_id: The staff is professional. I usually just drop off package there, so they process it really fast. However there is always a long line and the customers before me always take extremely long time. Since there is social distance measures and people have mask required so I don't mind that much wait inline :)
featured_reviews.review_text: The staff is professional. I usually just drop off package there, so they process it really fast. However there is always a long line and the customers before me always take extremely long time. Since there is social distance measures and people have mask required so I don't mind that much wait inline :)

featured_reviews.review_id: I've been going here for like a decade and it's been pretty mediocre in service. There was a short older Asian lady at the counter working mornings who always seemed to be in a bad mood and whenever I asked her anything she would basically shout back the answer at me like I was stupid. The older Asian man hasn't been that rude to me, but he's just really slow and seems kind of miserable. Haven't had any trouble with any of the other staff, but the evening people seem to sometimes take their lunch without someone to cover for them, and leave a sign up "will be back in 30 minutes". Not sure if she still works there but there was one young lady who was excellent with customers. White lady with brown hair. Super nice and super helpful when you had a problem. There were a couple times that I went in the next business day after 1 pm to get my package and it wasn't at the post office yet. I would recommend going 2 or 3 business days after receiving your door knocker, just to be sure.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Worst location.
Employees could take a course in customer service.
Staff is condescending and rude.
They outright blame Canada Post about their notification showing that packages are ready for pick up being fake and should wait a day or until you get a reminder.

How lazy is that when you see them have no customers and a pile of packages to scan in, they're instead standing around gossiping.

Do a full circle of Shoppers to not interrupt them and nope, they're still gossiping and get mad at you for interrupting.

The senior Asian lady with the long wavy hair is the worst.

featured_reviews.review_id: A lot of people say this location is really bad. Just went here today, the lady working, Padma, was great! Quick, friendly, and professional.
featured_reviews.review_text: A lot of people say this location is really bad. Just went here today, the lady working, Padma, was great! Quick, friendly, and professional.

featured_reviews.review_id: I attended this RPO yesterday to do a Telus return...no return label or instructions from Telus!  Clerk took the parcel, printed a label, gave me a receipt with the tracking number (which he explained) and told me to have a good day!
featured_reviews.review_text: I attended this RPO yesterday to do a Telus return...no return label or instructions from Telus!  Clerk took the parcel, printed a label, gave me a receipt with the tracking number (which he explained) and told me to have a good day!

featured_reviews.review_id: Good service, not as quick as I expected it to be but.. there's that bald man with glasses that handles stuff very quickly and sorta rushes, I wanted stamps and he thought I was a stamp collector so he found the most expensive stamps possible until I told him all I need to do is mail. It is ok though, I came here for flexdelivery and their service is good. All I need to say is they need some more space and they need to have more cashiers.

featured_reviews.review_id: The old guy there (I am not young either) would not let me use their hand cart to bring in my big heavy box which a friend helped to put in my car. I had to carry it in and was not easy. So if you need to do the same invest in a hand cart of your own. Was it a racial issue? I don't know.

featured_reviews.review_id: Attempted to cash my Canada Post money order here. First the worker told me he was new so he'd need to call his boss to figure out how. After they spoke in a foreign language for a few minutes right in front of me he said they don't cash cheques here. I tried to explain that it's not a regular cheque, it's a Canada Post money order he still said no and told me to go to a bank.
